The Android Pay API is part of Google Play Services, so you only need to import the Google Play Services library to get everything you need. Or, you can choose the APIs you want to compile yourself.
 
 To import the entire Google Play Services library, follow these setup instructions.
 If you prefer to selectively compile only the APIs you need, then open the build.gradle file in the app module and add the following to the dependencies block:
 
 dependencies { 
 compile 'com.google.android.gms:play-services-wallet:9.4.0' 
 compile 'com.android.support:support-v4:24.1.1' 
 compile 'com.android.support:appcompat-v7:24.1.1' 
 }
 
 Modify your Manifest 

To enable Android Pay in your app, you need to add the following Android Pay meta-data to the application tag of your AndroidManifest.xml:
 
 Enables the Android Pay API
 
 android:name="com.google.android.gms.wallet.api.enabled"
 android:value="true"
